channel.title: Why does this sound off beat?
channel.description:
Just started this project tonight.
https://app.auxy.co/projects/UrhgP_aa7CwlD6SwefYT7w==
The part at the start is when it’s most noticeable.
Is it me or does the kick and synth not quite sync up? I’ve changed the synth and kick.
Am I just hearing things? lol
Thanks!

item.title: Why does this sound off beat?
item.dc:creator: KirkLurkPU
item.description:
if you want to make a choppy sound, then the best way to replicate a ducker without a ducker is manipulating the volume. Kinda like Future Bass, where we use a lot of choppy synths using volume.

Read full topic
item.source: Why does this sound off beat?

item.title: Why does this sound off beat?
item.dc:creator: traverse
item.description:
https://app.auxy.co/projects/VfSpXCBABolm5UYh1pIhOg==
Set something to trigger ducker, then lower the volume to nothing

(it still kinda sounded off so I offset the ducker trigger a bit forward. I think Auxys ducker just triggers slightly behind beat/trigger normally)

Read full topic

item.title: Why does this sound off beat?
item.dc:creator: YeahMarcYeah
item.description:
Thanks.

But I want to keep constant choppy gate sound that you get by setting duck to tempo. Idk how to get that if I set to trigger my samples.

Read full topic
item.source: Why does this sound off beat?

item.title: Why does this sound off beat?
item.dc:creator: YeahMarcYeah
item.description:
Thanks.

But I want to keep constant choppy gate sound that you get by setting duck to tempo. Idk how to get that if I set to trigger my samples.

item.source: Why does this sound off beat?

item.title: Why does this sound off beat?
item.dc:creator: KirkLurkPU
item.description:
yeah you could set the ducker to “Triggered by Samples” and/or set the glide to around 40ms so it doesn’t feel flat. I’ve checked and anything below 40 will still make it sound flat because of the ducker.

Read full topic
item.source: Why does this sound off beat?

item.title: Why does this sound off beat?
item.dc:creator: NotMiles
item.description:
Try setting the ducker to “trigger by samples”

Read full topic
